concise_definition: v. 决定, 决心, 裁决

definitions.explanation_en: To make a choice or come to a conclusion after consideration, often between two or more alternatives.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在经过思考后，在两个或多个选项之间做出选择或得出结论。
definitions.example_en: She decided to accept the job offer after careful thought.
definitions.example_cn: 经过深思熟虑后，她决定接受这份工作邀请。

definitions.explanation_en: To resolve firmly to do something, often implying determination or commitment.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指坚定地决心做某事，常带有决心或承诺的意味。
definitions.example_en: He decided never to give up on his dream of becoming a writer.
definitions.example_cn: 他决心永不放弃成为作家的梦想。

definitions.explanation_en: To make a formal judgment or ruling, especially in a legal or authoritative context.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在法律或权威语境中作出正式裁决或判决。
definitions.example_en: The judge decided in favor of the plaintiff after reviewing all the evidence.
definitions.example_cn: 法官在审查所有证据后，判决支持原告。

comparison.analysis: “Choose” (选择) 强调从多个选项中挑选一个，侧重于“挑选”这一动作本身，不一定包含深入的思考或后果评估。而 “decide” 更强调经过权衡、分析后的最终决定，常隐含责任或影响。
“Determine” (确定) 常用于更正式或客观的语境，强调通过逻辑、证据或外部因素得出一个不可更改的结论，有时带有强制性或必然性。而 “decide” 更强调主观意愿和主动选择，更具个人性。
“Resolve” (决心) 与 “decide” 在表示“下定决心”时相近，但 “resolve” 更强调坚定的意志和持久的承诺，常用于表达克服困难的决心，语气更强、更正式。例如：I resolve to change my habits. 而 “decide” 更中性，适用于日常决策。
